availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Theoderick Fisher (Carroll County, Kentucky, merchant, clergyman, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, merchant, clergyman, and justice of the peace. New Hampshire native. Merchant in Carroll County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Baptist clergyman in Ghent, Kentucky, in 1860. Justice of the peace in Carroll County in 1864.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 1, p. 34.; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 1, p. 3; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, p. 4.
